name: vscode-deno
description: A language server client for Deno.
author: Deno Land Inc.

commands.title: Cache Dependencies
commands.description: Cache the active workspace document and its dependencies.

commands.title: Reload Import Registries Cache
commands.description: Reload any cached import registry responses.

commands.title: Info
commands.description: Provide version info for the language server, this extension and VSCode.

commands.title: Language Server Status
commands.description: Provide a status document of the language server.

commands.title: Welcome
commands.description: Open the welcome page for the Deno extension.

commands.title: Enable
commands.description: Enable the Deno language server via workspace settings. This isn't necessary if your workspace root contains a `deno.json` file.

commands.title: Initialize Workspace Configuration
commands.description: Legacy alias for the 'Deno: Enable' command.

commands.title: Disable
commands.description: Disable the Deno language server via workspace settings.

commands.title: Run Task (Debug)
commands.description: Run a Deno task in debug mode.

commands.title: Open Task Definition
commands.description: Open the definition of a Deno task.

commands.title: Refresh Tasks
commands.description: Refresh the list of Deno tasks.

deno.enable.markdownDescription:
Controls if the Deno Language Server is enabled. When enabled, the extension will disable the built-in VSCode JavaScript and TypeScript language services, and will use the Deno Language Server instead.

If omitted, your preference will be inferred as true if there is a `deno.json[c]` at your workspace root and false if not.

If you want to enable only part of your workspace folder, consider using `deno.enablePaths` setting instead.

**Not recommended to be enabled globally.**

deno.cacheOnSave.markdownDescription: Controls if the extension should cache the active document's dependencies on save.

deno.disablePaths.markdownDescription:
Disables the Deno Language Server for specific paths. This will leave the built in TypeScript/JavaScript language server enabled for those paths. Takes priority over `deno.enablePaths`.

**Not recommended to be enabled in user settings.**

deno.enablePaths.markdownDescription:
Enables the Deno Language Server for specific paths, instead of for the whole workspace folder. This will disable the built in TypeScript/JavaScript language server for those paths.

When a value is set, the value of `"deno.enable"` is ignored.

The workspace folder is used as the base for the supplied paths. If for example you have all your Deno code in `worker` path in your workspace, you can add an item with the value of `./worker`, and the Deno will only provide diagnostics for the files within `worker` or any of its sub paths.

**Not recommended to be enabled in user settings.**

deno.path.markdownDescription: A path to the `deno` CLI executable. By default, the extension looks for `deno` in the `PATH`, but if set, will use the path specified instead.

deno.env.markdownDescription: Additional environment variables to pass to Deno processes. Overrides the user's env and `deno.envFile`. These will be overridden by more specific settings such as `deno.future` for `DENO_FUTURE`, and invariables like `NO_COLOR=1`.

deno.envFile.markdownDescription: Env file containing additional environment variables to pass to Deno processes. Overrides the user's env. These will be overridden by `deno.env`, more specific settings such as `deno.future` for `DENO_FUTURE`, and invariables like `NO_COLOR=1`.

deno.cache.markdownDescription: A path to the cache directory for Deno. By default, the operating system's cache path plus `deno` is used, or the `DENO_DIR` environment variable, but if set, this path will be used instead.

deno.certificateStores.markdownDescription: A list of root certificate stores used to validate TLS certificates when fetching and caching remote resources. This overrides the `DENO_TLS_CA_STORE` environment variable if set.

deno.codeLens.implementations.markdownDescription: Enables or disables the display of code lens information for implementations of items in the code.

deno.codeLens.references.markdownDescription: Enables or disables the display of code lens information for references of items in the code.

deno.codeLens.referencesAllFunctions.markdownDescription: Enables or disables the display of code lens information for all functions in the code.

deno.codeLens.test.markdownDescription: Enables or disables the display of code lenses that allow running of individual tests in the code.

deno.codeLens.testArgs.markdownDescription: Additional arguments to use with the run test code lens.  Defaults to `[ "--allow-all", "--no-check" ]`.

deno.config.markdownDescription:
The file path to a configuration file. This is the equivalent to using `--config` on the command line. The path can be either be relative to the workspace, or an absolute path.

It is recommend you name it `deno.json` or `deno.jsonc`.

**Not recommended to be set globally.**

deno.documentPreloadLimit.markdownDescription: Maximum number of file system entries to traverse when finding scripts to preload into TypeScript on startup. Set this to 0 to disable document preloading.

deno.forcePushBasedDiagnostics.markdownDescription: Disables the server-capability for pull diagnostics to force push-based diagnostics.

deno.future.deprecationMessage: Deno 2.0 has been released. This setting still affects 1.x.x installations, however.
deno.future.markdownDescription: Enable breaking features likely to be shipped in Deno 2.0.

deno.importMap.markdownDescription:
The file path to an import map. This is the equivalent to using `--import-map` on the command line.

[Import maps](https://deno.land/manual@v1.6.0/linking_to_external_code/import_maps) provide a way to "relocate" modules based on their specifiers. The path can either be relative to the workspace, or an absolute path.

**Not recommended to be set globally.**

enumDescriptions: Display inlay hints for literal arguments.
Display inlay hints for all literal and non-literal arguments.
deno.inlayHints.parameterNames.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable/disable inlay hints for parameter names.

deno.inlayHints.parameterNames.suppressW.markdownDescription: Do not display an inlay hint when the argument name matches the parameter.

deno.inlayHints.parameterTypes.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable/disable inlay hints for implicit parameter types.

deno.inlayHints.variableTypes.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable/disable inlay hints for implicit variable types.

deno.inlayHints.variableTypes.suppressWh.markdownDescription: Suppress type hints where the variable name matches the implicit type.

deno.inlayHints.propertyDeclarationTypes.markdownDescription: Enable/disable inlay hints for implicit property declarations.

deno.inlayHints.functionLikeReturnTypes..markdownDescription: Enable/disable inlay hints for implicit function return types.

deno.inlayHints.enumMemberValues.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable/disable inlay hints for enum values.

deno.maxTsServerMemory.markdownDescription: Maximum amount of memory the TypeScript isolate can use. Defaults to 3072 (3GB).

deno.suggest.imports.autoDiscover.markdownDescription: If enabled, when new hosts/origins are encountered that support import suggestions, you will be prompted to enable or disable it.  Defaults to `true`.

deno.trace.server.markdownDescription: Traces the communication between VS Code and the Deno Language Server.

deno.suggest.imports.hosts.markdownDescription: Controls which hosts are enabled for import suggestions.

deno.testing.args.markdownDescription: Arguments to use when running tests via the Test Explorer.  Defaults to `[ "--allow-all" ]`.

deno.tlsCertificate.markdownDescription: A path to a PEM certificate to use as the certificate authority when validating TLS certificates when fetching and caching remote resources. This is like using `--cert` on the Deno CLI and overrides the `DENO_CERT` environment variable if set.

deno.unsafelyIgnoreCertificateErrors.markdownDescription: **DANGER** disables verification of TLS certificates for the hosts provided. There is likely a better way to deal with any errors than use this option. This is like using `--unsafely-ignore-certificate-errors` in the Deno CLI.

deno.unstable.markdownDescription:
Controls which `--unstable-*` features tests will be run with when running them via the explorer.

**Not recommended to be enabled globally.**

deno.lint.markdownDescription:
Controls if linting information will be provided by the Deno Language Server.

**Not recommended to be enabled globally.**

deno.internalDebug.markdownDescription: Determines if the internal debugging information for the Deno language server will be logged to the _Deno Language Server_ console.

deno.internalInspect.markdownDescription: Enables the inspector server for the JS runtime used by the Deno Language Server to host its TS server. Optionally provide an address for the inspector listener e.g. "127.0.0.1:9222" (default).

deno.logFile.markdownDescription: Write logs to a file in a project-local directory.

deno.defaultTaskCommand.markdownDescription: Controls the default action when clicking on a task in the _Deno Tasks sidebar_.

args.description: Arguments to pass to the command.

env.description: Environment variables to set when executing the command.

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm i && npm run esbuild-plugin && npm i && npm run esbuild-base
scripts.esbuild: npm run esbuild-plugin -- --sourcemap && npm run esbuild-base -- --sourcemap
scripts.fmt: deno fmt .vscode .github client/src media schemas typescript-deno-plugin/src typescript-deno-plugin/*.md docs package.json tsconfig.json README.md CHANGELOG.md
scripts.postinstall: cd typescript-deno-plugin && npm i && cd ../client && npm i && cd ..
